resume_professionnel: Experienced software engineer, and hands-on engineering manager with 20+ years of product development experience in broadcast media, and 10+ years of experience in leading development teams (20+ engineers), hiring (10+ offers, 40+ interviews), HR personnel procedures, performance reviews, and project transitions.
competences_techniques: converter DLLs per media container format
Media file reader and writer components
competences_transversales: Mise en place de process de développement

missions: Development and team management for Nexio servers' applications in the Playout business unit.
Relocated from IL to CA and took on a larger role, including ownership of video server applications.
Led distributed teams: team of 6 in Burbank, team of 8 in Naperville, and team of 8 (indirect) in Beijing; unified teams through process changes.
Introduced peer reviews and repurposed components to enable cross-team collaboration as a single large team.
Adopted Scrum since 2014 and served as ScrumMaster for teams of 3 to 6 in Burbank.
Migrated source revision control to Mercurial and implemented Jenkins for CI across 30+ products.
Recipient of 'Reuse Innovation Award' for IP reuse contributing to Server business unit turnaround.
Released deliverables for Nexio Software Suite 6.0, 7.0, 8.0 and Global Proxy Suite 2.5, 3.0, 3.5.
Initiated, architected and executed SOA from concept to completion to facilitate decoupled UI clients; designed 2 web services and ~10 services.
Created 'Hercules' web service for web player solution based on MPEG-DASH.
Developed C++ engine to process URIs, handle sessions, and deliver segmented MP4 atoms (H.264, AAC).
Provided dynamic HTML5 player page; JavaScript source based on dash.js supporting multiple raster sizes and bit rates.
Contributed C# web service framework, CLI bridge layer, and device testing support.
Published functional, REST API, and URI specification documents.
Implemented JSON services on TCP stack using C++; created API framework classes and multi-threaded server socket classes.
Created header-only JSON parser on top of open source 'rapidjson' providing SAX-style reader.
Developed new services: Content Manager, Helper, Picon, and Requestor and evolved existing services including Encoder, GPRX, Helios, MB, Scavenger, and Transcoder.
Guided GPRX, Helper and Requestor services to completion and published 10 JSON protocol API documents for 3rd party and internal use.
Designed Content Manager service for primary-backup workflows: multi-threaded rules-based engine to manage media across domains.
Architected and developed UMID-based solution (gen 2) for workflow scalability and new workflow needs.
Led development of Scavenger and Transcoder for low-res proxy management; proposed new approaches and delivered two new 24/7 products.
Guided optimization of MediaBase DLL and desktop explorer (C++, MFC) to support 200K IDs and meet storage scalability needs, achieving UI performance within few milliseconds.
Proposed 'dta-handler' architecture in ftp-server to consolidate media formats into one product build; team implemented converter DLL per media container format for import/export.
Development and team management for Nexio editing applications.
Led team of 8 in Naperville and collaborated with an expanded team in Beijing (indirect reports).
Hired, mentored and built core editing team to size of 8.
Established development process documentation including consistent procedures and peer code review guidelines.
Implemented crash dump analysis procedures to troubleshoot hard-to-repeat issues.
Released deliverables for Video Editing Suite 2.5.
Proposed architecture and collaborated to develop server integration modules for video broadcast workflows.
Architected, designed and implemented fundamental DLL components for the evolution of a video editing product.
Developed major components in C++/Win32 including interactive playback architecture and media file reader/writer components.
Designed scalable decoder and encoder architectures.
Implemented video and audio rendering engines and hardware integration modules critical to post-production business.
Developed interactive picon and waveform drawing components.
Led 64-bit and Unicode migration of all modules across a codebase of over 4 million lines of code.
Worked on projects tied to product evolution after acquisitions (Harris Corporation acquired Leitch).
Software engineer at Star Media (startup) working on video editing software 'Velocity' for post-production.
Developed project media management tools, Render Bank, and video effects.
Contributed to early product development prior to acquisitions (DPS acquired Star Media; Leitch later acquired DPS).
